graph.calc

Class GraphStatistics

  • java.lang.Object
    • graph.calc.GraphStatistics

  • public class GraphStatistics
extends java.lang.Object
    This class implements the methods for calculating some basic network properties like closeness, centrality, etc.

      • closenessCentralityList

        public static double[] closenessCentralityList(DMGraph g)
                                        throws java.lang.Exception
        Calculates the closeness centrality for all the vertices. Closeness for a vertex is an inverse of the average geodesic distance from that to all the other vertices in the graph. However, the definition of closeness by Galnachev allows for calculating closeness for disconnected graphs. It is then sum_(t in V\v) 2^(-d(v,t)) where d(v,t) denotes the geodesic distance between v and t.
        Parameters:
        g - DMGraph that is to be analyzed.
        Returns:
        double[] of closeness centrality scores for all the nodes in the graph.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • networkDegreeCentralization

        public static double networkDegreeCentralization(DMGraph g)
                                          throws java.lang.Exception
        This method calculates the network degree centralization measure.
        Parameters:
        g - DMGraph g that is to be analyzed.
        Returns:

        Throws:
